meanings.definition: In a manner that prefigures or foreshadows something.
meanings.sent1: She spoke prefiguratively about the upcoming changes in the company.
meanings.sent2: The clouds moved prefiguratively, hinting at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat prefiguratively knocked over the vase, as if predicting the chaos that would follow.
meanings.sent4: His dreams prefiguratively painted a picture of success in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The old book prefiguratively revealed the secrets of the future to the curious reader.

meanings.definition: Serving as a prefiguration or foreshadowing of something.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a prefiguratively mysterious aura that captivated viewers.
meanings.sent2: Her prefiguratively accurate predictions always amazed her friends.
meanings.sent3: The prefiguratively designed costume made him look like a time-traveling wizard.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins stood prefiguratively against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The prefiguratively carved statue seemed to come to life in the moonlight.
